member.name: M:Buddy.BuddyClient.InvokeServiceMethod``2(System.Func{System.AsyncCallback,System.IAsyncResult},System.Func{System.IAsyncResult,``1},System.Func{``1,Buddy.BuddyClient.BlockCallback,``0},System.Action{``0,Buddy.BuddyCallbackParams},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This method is a wrapper for the Begin/End Async calls. By default when adding a Service Reference inside a portable class library Being/End calls are hidden (private) from the developer. The Buddy SDK needs these methods in order to get access to the IAsyncResult structure, which in turn allows the developer greater control of how the callback is handled. In order to user the Begin/End methods make sure that you add the following code to Reference.cs (the auto generated code file - when adding a service reference). The code needs to be added to the Buddy.BuddyService.BuddyServiceClient class, EVERYTIME after you update the service reference.
public new Buddy.BuddyService.BuddyService Channel { get { return (BuddyService)this; } }
Back to the method below, the first paramter is the callback that executes the Async Begin call, the second paramter is the callback that will execute the Async End call and should return the result. The third parameter is the callback that will process the result (after this function looks for standard errors, null values, etc.). The fourth paramter is the developer-supplied callback for the Buddy method. The last parameter should be true if you want to process Service-level exceptions in the 3rd callback yourself.
Note that this method checks for null returns as well as standard buddy error values and will not call your "callback" to process the result if it encounters one. It will just signal an error condition to the user.
Also note that in the 3rd parameter if you set BlockCallback.block to true, then the usercallback will never be called. This is used when you want to chain multiple WCF calls. Take a look at CreateUser for an example.

member.name: M:Buddy.AuthenticatedUser.FindUserAsync(System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.List{Buddy.User},Buddy.BuddyCallbackParams},System.Double,System.Double,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Buddy.UserGender,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Buddy.UserStatus,System.UInt32,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Find the public profiles of all users that match the serch parameters.
member.param: The async callback to call on success or error. The first parameter is a list of users that was found by this search, or an empty list if there are no results.
The latitude of the position to search from. Must be a value between -90.0 and 90.0.
The Longitude of the position to search from. Must be a value between -180.0 and 180.0.
The distance in meters from the specified latitude/longitude to search for results. To ignore this distance pass in 40075000 (the circumferance of the earth).
The maximum number of users to return with this search.
The gender of the users, use UserGender.Any to search for both.
Specifies the starting age for the range of ages to search in. The value must be >= 0.
Specifies the ending age for the range of ages to search in. The value must be > ageStart.
The status of the users to search for. Use UserStatus.Any to ignore this parameter.
Filter for users who have checked-in in the past 'checkinsWithinMinutes' number of minutes.
Search for the custom appTag that was stored with the user.
member.exception: When latitude or longitude are incorrect.
member.param: An optional user defined object that will be passed to the callback.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult handle that can be used to monitor progress on this call.

Groups can be used to batch-send push notifications to a number of users at the same time. The async callback to call on success or error. The first parameter is a list of group names with counts per group.
member.param: An optional user defined object that will be passed to the callback.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult handle that can be used to monitor progress on this call.

member.name: M:Buddy.NotificationsApple.SendRawMessageAsync(System.Action{System.Boolean,Buddy.BuddyCallbackParams},System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Send a raw message to a Apple device. Note that this call does not directly send the message but rather, adds the raw message to the queue of messages to be sent.
member.param: The async callback to call on success or error. The first parameter is true on success, false otherwise.
The message to send to the user.
The badge number to set on the icon. It is the application's responsibility to determine what number to set.
The notification sound to play.

Metadata to send with the message for the receiving application to use. Data should be specified as key/value pairs where each key and value are seperated by a comma and each pair is seperated by a ";" character including the last pair ie: key,value;key,value;. Leave empty or set to null if there is no metadata to send.
The ID of the user that should recieve the notification. If the user hasn't Registered their device, this method will fail.
Schedule the message to be delivered after a certain date.
Send messages to an entire group of users, not just a one.
An optional user defined object that will be passed to the callback.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult handle that can be used to monitor progress on this call.

The longitude from where the saerch will start.
Optionally limit the number of returned metadata items.
